intro: Gudrunia tuerckheimii, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a rare and striking plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme conditions. The plant features dark green, leathery leaves and produces small, bright red berries that are a notable characteristic. Its flowers are inconspicuous, with white petals and yellow stamens, typical of many members of the Ericaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gudrunia tuerckheimii is considered a species of conservation concern.
